answers.answer: I've had pains like yours. I lost weight and most of them vanished. I have a bit of stiffness in my arms still..mostly in the a.m., but after I get going..and the more I move..they seem to be O.K. I HAD to lose weight..I developed diabetes II and I had no choice. Atleast I didn't think the choice was much to think about. I was 300 and I've lost 90 lbs in a year. I've got 60 more to lose in the next year.I have the neck pain which radiates into my arms on occasion and I have to say that sometimes the pain in my arms..one or both at the same time lasts for afew day. It goes away and maybe visits me 2 months later. I've learned to deal with it, but truly..I think I'll eventually go to a doctor. It's hard when both arms hurt. I'm doing much better though since the weight loss and expect that the more I lose..the less pains and aches I'll have.GOOD LUCK TO YOU!!

question: Hi..I am 47 years old...Was told two years ago that I was in perimenopause.  I suffer from breast tenderness and tingles, some night sweats, irregular and light periods, fatigue, anxiety, anxiety, anxiety and more anxiety!...I also have gerds.I recently started feeling heaviness in my thighs and arms...Like I have been over excersising, but I havent been.  They feel fatigued, I have also had some twitching...I havent lost any strength in them, or range of motion...I can still run, jump etc....But I have to admit it has freaked me out since I googled the symptoms and it came back with MS or worse als.I started taking B12 sublingually a week and half ago, because I do take ppi twice a day for over a year...The twitching is almost gone, and the weakness and soreness seems to have subsided some, and I have sometimes where almost gone completely, but not quite....How long would it take for the vitamins to help me completely?  I also just started taking magnesium today....Anyone else out there have any similiar symptoms?  I also get sore neck and shoulders and even lower jaw sometimes feels tired (this may be from anxiety).  Any help putting my mind at ease would really help!!!...I also sometimes feel soreness in my knee joints and finger joints.
